choices.A: The upgrade is performed for a group of WAN Edge devices first to ensure data-plane availability when other controllers are being updated.
choices.B: Upgrade and reboot are performed first on vManage, then on vBond, then on vSmart, and finally on the Cisco WAN Edge devices.
choices.C: The upgrade is performed first on vManage, then on WAN Edge devices, then on vBond, and finally on vSmart. The reboot must start from WAN Edge devices.
choices.D: Upgrade and reboot are performed first on vBond, then on vSmart, and finally on the Cisco WAN Edge devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
it is B

Selected Answer: B
B.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/hardware-and-software-installation.html#best-practices-for-software-upgrades
B is correct

questions.question_text: What is the procedure to upgrade all Cisco SD-WAN devices to a recent version?

discussion.content:
Use biz-internet for business or enterprise-grade Internet connections.
Use public-internet for general public Internet connections.
B and C both correct, it depends on how you name your Internet feed?
Colors are already named as MPLS and Internet. So the only option that matches one of these colors is option D, but D does not fulfil the rest of the requirements. I would go with A in this case.

Answer [A]
Leaving the TLOC color as the default is still one of the public colors (meaning you don't need to define a preferred color, unless required or stated in the question)

The default color tunnel can still build controlled connections (DTLS) to other SD-WAN devices, Options B and C are practically the same, this lead me to believe neither of those are valid for the question.

Further Info - Link:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/routers/sd-wan/214148-configure-connectivity-between-different.html

I can't make sense of this question really. B and C are basically same thing and they said not MPLS. So I'd go with A even though you actually don't configure color on the vManage or controllers normally. There are control connections established using the colors defined on remote end so if default is used on controllers I think it would be just like not having anything on them but won't have my lab spun back up for a few weeks to verify.
could be all of them, default public-internet, biz-internet. I guess question is not correctly spelled out
I agree with A, because the engineer is configuring the controller not a WAN Edge. In the controllers we don't use colors.

comments.content:
From design guide (https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/cisco-sdwan-design-guide.html): "The color attribute applies to WAN Edge routers or vManage and vSmart controllers".
So, controllers are using colors.
Also, there is no color default.

The default color exists and is used by the controller when a specific color is not set. If you have a lab or real environment, please check your controller's VPN 0 configuration. The controller supports color, but it is not considered best practice to change it.

This is an example of vSmart's control connection.
0 vmanage 10 0 223.1.1.12 12346 223.1.1.10 12346 1.1.1.10 dtls default default 223.1.1.10

discussion.content:
B.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/cisco-sdwan-design-guide.html
The public colors are 3g, biz-internet, blue, bronze, custom1, custom2, custom3, default, gold, green, lte, public-internet, red, and silver.

A,E

PnP portal is cisco poral, so " from inside" or "on-prem" is not related to PnP. so we have 2 options :

1. Device list using PnP will be sync via smart account
2. Manually upload device list

To transfer device information from Cisco PnP portal to Cisco SD-WAN Manager, sync your Smart Account or Virtual account in Cisco SD-WAN Manager. You need Cisco credentials of the Virtual Account administrator role for this step. For more information about uploading the WAN Edge router serial numbers, see Upload WAN Edge Router Serial Numbers from Cisco Smart Account.
D and E are correct
Typo below : "sync to smart account"

D&E are correct.
Sync to smart controller doesn't bring down the WAN edge list, Auto Sync Option:
Admin> settings > PnP Connect sync would be correct.

comments.content: There are two ways, that you say is one but the key word it is that the vManage can access to PnP portal. The D options it is the manual way but you can upload the cEdge list from PnP and then send to controller so A and E are correct

questions.question_text: What prohibits deleting a VNF image from the software repository?

choices.B: if the image is referenced by a service chain
choices.A: if the image is stored by vManage
choices.C: if the image is included in a configured policy
choices.D: if the image is uploaded by a WAN Edge device
